page.title: 17Walks Around Southwell
page.content: There is a walk around{Southwell } called {The Westhorpe Circular. }You can buy leaflets about it from Southwell library. To start this walk you start at {Cotmoor Lane End,}which is down {Oxton Road.}For the first quarter of a mile the lane is a hard core track with wide green verges.The path continues as a green lane with deep ruts which {can be wet in dry {weather.}Continue until reaching the far side of the first wood on the left hand side (this wood is now scarcely more than a few trees along the edge of the lane) These directions are only a few from the booklet available. The{ {Southwell Trial}is a disused railway, a few signs of the track can still be seen, such as, part of the rails and the station house.{The Trail}runs through to {Farnsfield.}It is approximately {five miles }long.
